intro: Reseda barrelieri subsp. sessiliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mignonette, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, sessile leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features. Due to its resilience and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
